cyclone.name: IRMA
cyclone.current_location: about 20 miles ENE of St. Thomas, U.S. Virgin Islands
cyclone.trajectory: Continuing west-northwest, expected to pass near the Turks & Caicos and southeast Bahamas Thursday–Friday, then curve toward south-central Florida and move northward up the peninsula
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: South Florida / Florida Keys (first U.S. landfall zone)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch in effect for Cuba Matanzas-Guantánamo and Central Bahamas (no Florida watches yet)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Hurricane Warnings Leeward Islands, Virgin Islands, Puerto Rico, north coast of Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos and SE Bahamas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire Florida peninsula, especially south and west coasts, and eastern Gulf Coast within 4-5-day cone
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds increasingly likely (47% chance), with a 20% chance of ≥50-kt winds and up to 11% for hurricane-force (64-kt) winds by day-5.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential for life-threatening storm surge in Tampa Bay if Irma tracks up or just east of the west-coast; inundation exceeding 3 ft possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: Heavy rainfall bands could bring 4–8 in. totals with local higher amounts, producing flash-flood risk.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Large battering waves, dangerous rip currents, possible port-side flooding and debris; long-duration port closure and vessel restrictions anticipated.
